tags.name: [params.resolvePresence]
tags.description: An optional function for resolving presence for an endpoint.

description.full:
respoke.Endpoints are users of a Respoke app.

An Endpoint can be a person in a browser or device, or an app using Respoke APIs from a server.

A Client can interact with endpoints through messages, audio or video calls, or direct connections.

An Endpoint may be authenticated from multiple devices to the same app (each of which is represented by a Connection).
description.summary: respoke.Endpoints are users of a Respoke app.
description.body:
An Endpoint can be a person in a browser or device, or an app using Respoke APIs from a server.

A Client can interact with endpoints through messages, audio or video calls, or direct connections.

An Endpoint may be authenticated from multiple devices to the same app (each of which is represented by a Connection).

code:
var instanceId = params.instanceId;
    var that = respoke.Presentable(params);

description.full: A name to identify the type of this object.
description.summary: A name to identify the type of this object.

description.full: A direct connection to this endpoint. This can be used to send direct messages.
description.summary: A direct connection to this endpoint. This can be used to send direct messages.

tags.name: [params.onSuccess]
tags.description:
- Success handler for this invocation of this
method only.

tags.name: [params.onError]
tags.description:
- Error handler for this invocation of this method
only.

description.full:
Send a message to the endpoint through the infrastructure.

endpoint.sendMessage({ message: "wassuuuuup" });

Using callbacks will disable promises.
description.summary: Send a message to the endpoint through the infrastructure.
description.body:
endpoint.sendMessage({ message: "wassuuuuup" });

Using callbacks will disable promises.

tags.name: [params.onError]
tags.description:
- Callback for errors that happen during call setup or
media renegotiation.

tags.name: [params.onLocalMedia]
tags.description:
- Callback for receiving an HTML5 Video
element with the local audio and/or video attached.

tags.name: [params.onConnect]
tags.description:
- Callback for receiving an HTML5 Video
element with the remote
audio and/or video attached.

tags.name: [params.onHangup]
tags.description:
- Callback for being notified when the call has been
hung up.

tags.name: [params.onAllow]
tags.description:
- When setting up a call, receive notification that the
browser has granted access to media.

tags.name: [params.onMute]
tags.description:
- Callback for changing the mute state on any type of media.
This callback will be called when media is muted or unmuted.

tags.name: [params.onAnswer]
tags.description: - Callback for when the callee answers the call.

tags.name: [params.onApprove]
tags.description:
- Callback for when the user approves local media. This
callback will be called whether or not the approval was based on user feedback. I. e., it will be called even if
the approval was automatic.

tags.name: [params.onRequestingMedia]
tags.description:
- Callback for when the app is waiting
for the user to give permission to start getting audio or video.

tags.name: [params.onStats]
tags.description:
- Callback for receiving statistical
information.

tags.name: [params.previewLocalMedia]
tags.description:
- A function to call if the developer
wants to perform an action between local media becoming available and calling approve().

tags.name: [params.receiveOnly]
tags.description: - whether or not we accept media

tags.name: [params.sendOnly]
tags.description: - whether or not we send media

tags.name: [params.needDirectConnection]
tags.description: - flag to enable skipping media & opening direct connection.

tags.name: [params.forceTurn]
tags.description:
- If true, media is not allowed to flow peer-to-peer and must flow through
relay servers. If it cannot flow through relay servers, the call will fail.

tags.name: [params.disableTurn]
tags.description:
- If true, media is not allowed to flow through relay servers; it is
required to flow peer-to-peer. If it cannot, the call will fail.

tags.name: [params.connectionId]
tags.description:
- The connection ID of the remoteEndpoint, if it is not desired to call
all connections belonging to this endpoint.

description.full:
Create a new audio-only call.

endpoint.startAudioCall({
    onConnect: function (evt) {}
});

description.full:
Create a new call with audio and video.

    onConnect: function (evt) {}
});
description.summary: Create a new call with audio and video.

tags.description: - Pass in an optional html video element to have local video attached to it.

tags.name: [params.videoRemoteElement]
tags.description: - Pass in an optional html video element to have remote video attached to it.

tags.name: [params.onSuccess]
tags.description:
- Success handler for this
invocation of this method only.

tags.name: [params.onError]
tags.description:
- Error handler for this invocation of this
method only.

tags.name: [params.onStart]
tags.description:
- A callback for when setup of the direct
connection begins. The direct connection will not be open yet.

tags.name: [params.onOpen]
tags.description:
- A callback for receiving notification of when
the DirectConnection is open and ready to be used.

tags.name: [params.onError]
tags.description:
- Callback for errors setting up the direct
connection.

tags.name: [params.onClose]
tags.description:
- A callback for receiving notification of
when the DirectConnection is closed and the two Endpoints are disconnected.

tags.name: [params.onAccept]
tags.description:
- Callback for when the user accepts the
request for a direct connection and setup begins.

tags.name: [params.onMessage]
tags.description:
- A callback for receiving messages sent
through the DirectConnection.

tags.name: [params.connectionId]
tags.description:
- An optional connection ID to use for this connection. This allows
the connection to be made to a specific instance of an endpoint in the case that the same endpoint is logged
in from multiple locations.

tags.string:
{respoke.DirectConnection} The DirectConnection which can be used to send data and messages
directly to the other endpoint.

description.full:
Create a new DirectConnection. This method creates a new Call as well, attaching this DirectConnection to it for the purposes of creating a peer-to-peer link for sending data such as messages to the other endpoint. Information sent through a DirectConnection is not handled by the cloud infrastructure. If there is already a direct connection open, this method will resolve the promise with that direct connection instead of attempting to create a new one.

endpoint.startDirectConnection({
    onOpen: function (evt) {}
});
description.summary: Create a new DirectConnection. This method creates a new Call as well, attaching this DirectConnection to it for the purposes of creating a peer-to-peer link for sending data such as messages to the other endpoint. Information sent through a DirectConnection is not handled by the cloud infrastructure. If there is already a direct connection open, this method will resolve the promise with that direct connection instead of attempting to create a new one.

description.full: Find the presence out of all known connections with the highest priority (most availability) and set it as the endpoint's resolved presence.
description.summary: Find the presence out of all known connections with the highest priority (most availability) and set it as the endpoint's resolved presence.

description.full: Sort the connections array by the priority of the value of the presence of that connectionId. This will cause the first element in the list to be the id of the session with the highest priority presence so we can access it by the 0 index. TODO: If we don't really care about the sorting and only about the highest priority we could use Array.prototype.every to improve this algorithm.
description.summary: Sort the connections array by the priority of the value of the presence of that connectionId. This will cause the first element in the list to be the id of the session with the highest priority presence so we can access it by the 0 index. TODO: If we don't really care about the sorting and only about the highest priority we could use Array.prototype.every to improve this algorithm.

description.full:
Get the Connection with the specified id. The connection ID is optional if only one connection exists.

var connection = endpoint.getConnection({
    connectionId: "XXXXXXXX-XXXX-XXXX-XXXX-XXXXXXXXXXXXX"
});
description.summary: Get the Connection with the specified id. The connection ID is optional if only one connection exists.

description.full: Handle messages sent to the logged-in user from this one Endpoint. This callback is called every time respoke.Endpoint#message fires.
description.summary: Handle messages sent to the logged-in user from this one Endpoint. This callback is called every time respoke.Endpoint#message fires.

tags.description: - the Endpoint's presence

description.full: Handle presence notifications from this one Endpoint. This callback is called every time respoke.Endpoint#message fires.
description.summary: Handle presence notifications from this one Endpoint. This callback is called every time respoke.Endpoint#message fires.
